intro: Axinaea dependens, commonly known as the hanging axinaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences, which consist of small, clustered flowers that hang from the stems. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. Axinaea dependens is often found in humid, shaded environments within cloud forests.
